title: Loss of Home : From Fiji to Germany
description: Hear from people in Fiji and Germany and how the struggle to keep fossil fuels in the ground and fight off worsening climate impacts connects them

title: Climate justice in Sápmi: Sarakka Gaup & Mio Negga
place: Arctic regions of Sweden, Norway, Finland and Russia
description: The indigenous Saami live in the Arctic regions of Sweden, Norway, Finland and Russia, at the frontlines of climate change

title: At Palau Pacific Resort
author: Emelihter Kihleng
description: A poem by Pohnpeian poet Emelihter Kihleng inspired by the Palau Pacific Resort motto 'like no other island dream'

title: UNESCO: Protect the Great Barrier Reef, Not Coal!
position: Pacific Ocean / East of Australian coast
description: Up to 50% of the Great Barrier Reef may be dead already thanks to climate change.

title: Evelyn Flores: The Caregiver’s Story
description: A poem by Evelyn Flores from Guam about urohs, intricately embroidered Pohnpeian skirts adopted by Chuukese women as everyday wear

title: Selina Leem: This is Our Land Marshall Islands
description: Selina Leem was a clarion voice for the Marshall Islands at the COP21 climate talks in Paris, and continues to push for climate action with urgency

title: Kathy Jetnil-Kijiner: Dear Matafele Peinam
description: Kathy performed her poetry at the Opening Ceremony of the UN Climate Summit in New York in 2014

title: Craig Santos Perez: Praise Song for Oceania
description: The words chanted are the words for ocean in various Pacific languages

title: Serena Ngaio Simmons: Gaia
description: A poem by Maori poet Serena Ngaio Simmons about the Earth Mother Gaia's wrath

title: Terisa Tinei Siagatonu: Layers
description: Terisa performed her poetry on climate justice live at the COP21 Paris

title: Have Your Sei: Sign the Pacific Climate Warrior Declaration on Climate Change
description: This year, with Fiji as the President of COP 23, the Pacific region will show the world what true climate leadership is

title: Frontline Truths: Kiribati
description: In late February 2015, king tides hit Kiribati destroying the Betio Maternity Hospital, destroyed food supplies and contaminated freshwater supplies

title: No'u Revilla: Basket
description: A poem by Hawaiian poet No'u Revilla for Kathy Jetnil-Kijiner and the Marshall Islands

title: Brandy Nālani McDougall: Water remembers
description: A poem by Hawaiian poet Brandy Nālani McDougall to remember the waters of Waikīkī

title: Raise a Paddle: a journey from the Pacific Islands to the tar sands
description: In memory and thanks to Pacific Climate Warrior Koreti Tiamalu

title: Pacific Islander Climate Change Poetry
description: This is a special issue on climate change poetry by native Pacific Islander poets from across the Pacific and diaspora
